head.title: Reinventing John Jay Or Merely Redistricting?

hedline.hl1: Reinventing John Jay Or Merely Redistricting?

block.p: The school has needed reinvention for some years.

In the days when it was Manual Training, I lived in an apartment building at 474 Fourth Street, just up the block from the school. My four-story apartment house was one of three torn down to make way for the extension of the school.
The school has needed reinvention for some years.

In the days when it was Manual Training, I lived in an apartment building at 474 Fourth Street, just up the block from the school. My four-story apartment house was one of three torn down to make way for the extension of the school.

One afternoon, while I was riding a scooter on Seventh Avenue, a riot broke out among the school's students and I'll never forget one student being hit over the head by an ice-cream store's metal sign.

Because of similar incidents at the time, I made up my mind to secure a scholarship at a school away from the neighborhood so I wouldn't have to attend Manual Training. So I have always since been grateful to the school for spurring my intention to secure a scholarship to Xavier High School in Manhattan.
LEO T. TARPEY Park Slope, Brooklyn
